Name: Reconnaissance (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to gather information they can use to plan future operations.

Name: Resource Development (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to establish resources they can use to support operations.

Name: Initial Access (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to get into your network.

Name: Execution (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

Name: Persistence (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

Name: Privilege Escalation (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

Name: Defense Evasion (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

Name: Credential Access (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords.

Name: Discovery (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

Name: Lateral Movement (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

Name: Collection (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.

Name: Command and Control (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems to control them.

Name: Exfiltration (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

Name: Impact (Enterprise)
Description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.

Name: Initial Access (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to get into your device.

Name: Execution (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

Name: Persistence (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

Name: Privilege Escalation (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

Name: Defense Evasion (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

Name: Credential Access (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to steal account names, passwords, or other secrets that enable access to resources.

Name: Discovery (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

Name: Lateral Movement (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

Name: Collection (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.

Name: Command and Control (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised devices to control them.

Name: Exfiltration (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

Name: Impact (Mobile)
Description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your devices and data.

Name: Initial Access (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to get into your ICS environment.

Name: Execution (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to run code or manipulate system functions, parameters, and data in an unauthorized way.

Name: Persistence (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold in your ICS environment.

Name: Privilege Escalation (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

Name: Evasion (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to avoid security defenses.

Name: Discovery (ICS)
Description: The adversary is locating information to assess and identify their targets in your environment.

Name: Lateral Movement (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to move through your ICS environment.

Name: Collection (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest and domain knowledge on your ICS environment to inform their goal.

Name: Command and Control (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to communicate with and control compromised systems, controllers, and platforms with access to your ICS environment.

Name: Inhibit Response Function (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to prevent your safety, protection, quality assurance, and operator intervention functions from responding to a failure, hazard, or unsafe state.

Name: Impair Process Control (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, disable, or damage physical control processes.

Name: Impact (ICS)
Description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your ICS systems, data, and their surrounding environment.
